member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.DirectImageFeed

member.summary: Determines whether internal binding is required for dynamically loaded types. This may be the case with some Mono distributions.
member.returns: true if internal binding is required, false otherwise

member.summary: injects 640 x 480 RGB frames directly to Extreme Motion SDK

640 x 480 RGB frame to inject to Extreme Motion SDK

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey
member.summary: The unique key assigned internally to each delivered IFrame. This is composed of the unique frame number that is the origin of the data conveyed by this frame and a latent term to enable efficient hashing.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Overloaded. Compares two FrameKey objects to see if they contain the same data.
member.returns: true if the second object contains the same data as this instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey.Equals(Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey)
member.summary: Compares two FrameKey objects for equality (using the FrameKey type).
member.returns: true if the second object contains the same data as this instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets the hash code for a FrameKey.
member.returns: The calculated hash code.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey.op_Equality(Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey,Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey)
member.summary: Compares two FrameKey objects for equality.
member.returns: true if the two instances are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey.op_Inequality(Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey,Xtr3D.Net.FrameKey)
member.summary: Compares two FrameKey objects for inequality.
member.returns: false if the two instances are equal; otherwise, true.

member.returns: a human-readable string that is culture-sensitive

member.summary: Landscape

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ImageResolution.Resolution480x640
member.summary: Portrait

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ImageResolution.Resolution1920x1080
member.summary: HD Landscape. Windows only.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.ImageWarnings
member.summary: Warnings related to the RGB image

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ImageWarnings.None
member.summary: No warning in the image

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ImageWarnings.LightLow
member.summary: The environmental light is very low and can degrade the performance. The end-user should be asked to increase the light (for example: turn on the lights in a dark room)

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ImageWarnings.StrongBacklighting
member.summary: The image received in the camera is extremely bright and it reduces the details seen on it. It can happen if a strong light-source is pointing directly into the camera. The end-user should be alerted to this and asked to change the camera/light-source location.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ImageWarnings.TooManyPeople
member.summary: There is more than one user in front of the camera during the calibration stage and it is not clear which one should be the main, calibrated, user. The end-user should be alerted , for example: ask that only one user will be in the middle of camera field-of-view during calibration stage.

member.summary: Utility method to fill the width and height parameters from the resolution.

member.summary: Gets the FourCC uint code of the image.

member.summary: Gets the height of the image.

member.summary: Gets the width of the image.

member.summary: Gets the stride of the image.

member.summary: Gets the bits per pixel of the image.

member.summary: Gets the total size of the image, in bytes.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.ImageInfo.ImageFormat
member.summary: Enumeration of available image formats.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ImageInfo.ImageFormat.RGB888
member.summary: Supported in PC, iOS and Android

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ImageInfo.ImageFormat.RGBA8888
member.summary: Supported in iOS Can be used to improve RGB drawing in engines which use this format natively in their structures, such as unity.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Joint
member.summary: Contains joint data for one skeleton joint, such as the joint type, position, and whether the joint is being tracked

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Joint.skeletonPoint
member.summary: Gets the position of the joint.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Joint.jointType
member.summary: Gets the joint type, which identifies a portion of the skeleton.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Joint.jointTrackingState
member.summary: Gets the tracking state of the joint, which indicates the quality of the joint position that was produced by the skeleton DataStream.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Joint.#ctor(Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Interop.Types.JointType,Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Point,Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Interop.Types.JointTrackingState)
member.summary: creates a new joint. Normally joints are created and filled by the stream, this can be used by none-friend assemblies for mocking and testing purposes.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Interop.Types.JointTrackingState
member.summary: Skeleton joint tracking states. Depending on the data available in the ColorImageStream, the skeleton data stream may produce joints that are fully tracked, inferred, or not tracked.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Interop.Types.JointTrackingState.NotTracked
member.summary: Joint data is not tracked; there is no joint data available.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Interop.Types.JointTrackingState.Inferred
member.summary: Joint data is inferred by calculating it from other tracked joints. Since the data is calculated, confidence in the data is very low.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Interop.Types.JointTrackingState.Tracked
member.summary: Joint data is tracked and available. Since the data is tracked, confidence in the data is very high.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeFrameHeader
member.summary: The header that is contained by all frames, holds general information about the frame: type of frame, id, timestamp and the frame's size.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Point
member.summary:
Contains a 3D position (or point) in skeleton space, as well as a 2D position (or source pixel) in camera space. X,Y,Z: The three dimensional Cartesian coordinate system of the joints is composed of the 3 axes X, Y, and Z. In each frame, the origin of the coordinates system (0, 0, 0) is set to the middle of the line connecting the shoulders. The coordinate system measurement unit is “user arm length.” A vector of length 1 is equal to the length of the user’s arm.
imgCoordNormHorizontal and imgCoordNormVertical: Each point also contains two coordinates which represent the location of the joint in the image. These coordinates are in the range [0-1] and are relative to the width and the height of the image. For example, for an image at the resolution 640x480 imgCoordNormHorizontal = 1 means that the X location of the joint in the image is 639.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Point.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the (x,y,z) position.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Point.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the (x,y,z) position.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Point.Z
member.summary: Gets or sets the z-coordinate of the (x,y,z) position.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Point.ImgCoordNormHorizontal
member.summary: Gets or sets the normalized horizontal coordinate of the 2D position.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Point.ImgCoordNormVertical
member.summary: Gets or sets the normalized vertical coordinate of the 2D position.

member.summary: Gets the hash code for a Point.

member.summary: Compares two Point objects for equality.
member.returns: true if the two instances are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Point.op_Inequality(Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Point,Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.Point)
member.summary: Compares two Point objects for inequality.
member.returns: false if the two instances are equal; otherwise, true.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.TrackingState
member.summary: The different states a user skeleton can be found in. The state-machine is: Initializing change to Calibrating, then after user found and calibrated, changes to Tracking. Tracking will change to NotTracking and vice versa when the user exists/re-enter the frame. The only way to return to Calibrating state is to call GeneratorSingleton.Instance.Reset() explicitly.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.TrackingState.Initializing
member.summary: Initializing the system.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.TrackingState.NotTracked
member.summary: Do not track anything.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.TrackingState.Calibrating
member.summary: Waiting to Calibrate the user using the 'Psi' pose.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.ExtremeMotion.Data.TrackingState.Tracked
member.summary: Track joint positions after calibration is complete.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeSkeleton
member.summary: A structure that holds a skeleton as passed from the native code. Contains all the information that was acquired per one frame. Includes the tracking state of the skeleton, its id within the array of skeletons (which is currently of maximum size 1), the skeleton's proximity to the camera and an array of its joints (positions and tracking states).

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeSkeleton.state
member.summary: The state of tracking the skeleton is in (Initializing/NotTracked/Calibrating/Tracked).

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeSkeleton.skeletonId
member.summary: The serial number of the skeleton within the skeleton array (currently the array is of maximum size 1).

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeSkeleton.skeletonProximity
member.summary: The proximity of the skeleton to the camera.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeSkeleton.joints
member.summary: An array of the skeleton's joints.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeSkeletonFrame
member.summary: A structure that holds all information regarding detection of skeleton(s) per specific frame. Contains a header with general information about the frame, the number of skeletons it holds (currently the maximum is 1), and an array of skeleton(s).

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeSkeletonFrame.header
member.summary: Frame header, contains information about the frame (type, frame id, timestamp, size)

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeSkeletonFrame.numOfSkeletons
member.summary: The number of skeletons detected. Maximum is Constants.MAX_SKELETON_ARRAY_SIZE (Currently set to 1).

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeSkeletonFrame.skeletonDataPtrDummy
member.summary: Place holder to match the native struct.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.NativeSkeletonFrame.skeletonData
member.summary: Array of skeletons that were detected. Maximum is Constants.MAX_SKELETON_ARRAY_SIZE (Currently set to 1).

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.Patterns.AutoLock
member.summary: Enforces a synchronization domain for the current context and all contexts that share the same instance, allowing multiple threads for reading or exclusive access for writing.
member.remarks: This was originally designed to provide light-weight, recursion-free support for the synchronization of static "C style" calls where no context can be established. This uses ReaderWriterLockSlim internally, note for FW-related implied implications on fairness and recursion policy.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.Patterns.AutoLock.#ctor(System.Threading.ReaderWriterLockSlim,Xtr3D.Net.Patterns.AutoLock.AutoLockMode)
member.summary: Constructs a new AutoLock instance
member.param: The lock used to manage access
The initial AutoLock state, allowed states are AutoLockMode.Read or above

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.Patterns.AutoLock.UpgradeToWrite
member.summary: Upgrades the current AutoLock to the "Write" state.
member.remarks: If the current thread does not hold the lock in UpgradeableRead mode, this will throw an InvalidOperationException.
member.returns: A write lock

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.Patterns.AutoLock.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose of the current AutoLock

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.Patterns.AutoLock.AutoLockMode
member.summary: AutoLock state

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Patterns.AutoLock.AutoLockMode.None
member.summary: Initial non-locking mode

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Patterns.AutoLock.AutoLockMode.Read
member.summary: In this state, one or more threads have entered the lock for read access to the protected resource.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Patterns.AutoLock.AutoLockMode.UpgradeableRead
member.summary: In this state, one thread has entered the lock for read access with the option to upgrade to write access (that is, in upgradeable mode), and zero or more threads have entered the lock for read access. No more than one thread at a time can enter the lock with the option to upgrade; additional threads that try to enter upgradeable mode, and thus their UtoLock construction, are blocked.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Patterns.AutoLock.AutoLockMode.Write
member.summary: In this state, one thread has entered the lock for write access to the protected resource. That thread has exclusive possession of the lock. Any other thread that tries to enter the lock for any reason will be treated with a InvalidOperationException.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.BaseTypes.GeneratorBase
member.summary: Base class for implementing the IGenerator interface.

member.name: T:Xtr3D.Net.IGenerator
member.summary: An IStreamer source

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.IGenerator.Initialize(Xtr3D.Net.BaseTypes.PlatformType)
member.summary: Initializes the generator instance to run on the specified PlatformType.
member.param: PlatformType on which the application is currently running.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.IGenerator.Shutdown
member.summary: Shuts-down this generator instance, releasing all resources allocated by it. Expected to be called only once, in the end of the application life.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.IGenerator.Start
member.summary: Starts this generator instance's IStreamer-s. Throws recoverable errors: CameraAbsentException,CameraBusyException which should be handled by the application (usually by showing a message to the user to connect/free the camera and then call this method again)

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.IGenerator.Stop
member.summary: Stops this generator instance's IStreamer-s, releasing any scares resources allocated by it, e.g. a camera.

member.name: M:Xtr3D.Net.IGenerator.Reset
member.summary: Resets this generator instance's state to what it was on the return of the original call to Initialize(PlatformType platform). To resume activity you must call Start() after reseting.

member.name: P:Xtr3D.Net.IGenerator.IsInitialized
member.summary: Whether or not this generator instance is initialized and returns true if it is, or false otherwise.

member.name: P:Xtr3D.Net.IGenerator.ClientID
member.summary: Holds the unique ID assigned to this generator instance

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.BaseTypes.GeneratorBase.POLLING_INTERVAL
member.summary: The time in milliseconds between polling. Used only when StreamingPolicy is set to StreamingPolicy.POLL. Was set by trial and error - the current value is the longest interval in which (almost) no frames are lost.

member.name: F:Xtr3D.Net.Interop.Types.EPowerLineFrequency.PLF_60HZ
